00070   MatrixException::MatrixException( const char* msg )
00071   {
00072     unsigned msgLength = 0;
00073     if( msg == NULL )
00074     {
00075 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
00076       strcpy_s( m_msg, 256, "Unknown Matrix Exception" );
00077 #else
00078       strcpy( m_msg, "Unknown Matrix Exception" );
00079 #endif
00080     }
00081     else
00082     {
00083       msgLength = (unsigned)strlen( msg );
00084       // note 255 here, not 256, 
00085       // just in case msgLength is 255 and we add '\0' to the end of m_msg.
00086 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
00087       if( msgLength < 255 )
00088       {
00089         strncpy_s( m_msg, 256, msg, msgLength );
00090         m_msg[msgLength] = '\0';
00091       }
00092       else
00093       {
00094         strncpy_s( m_msg, 256, msg, 255 );
00095         m_msg[255] = '\0';
00096       }
00097 #else
00098       if( msgLength < 255 )
00099       {
00100         strncpy( m_msg, msg, msgLength );
00101         m_msg[msgLength] = '\0';
00102       }
00103       else
00104       {
00105         strncpy( m_msg, msg, 255 );
00106         m_msg[255] = '\0';
00107       }
00108 #endif
00109     }
00110     m_ExceptionString = m_msg;
00111   }
00112 
00113   MatrixException::MatrixException(const MatrixException& matrix_exception)
00114   {
00115     // This will copy only the matrix exception string.
00116     m_ExceptionString = matrix_exception.m_ExceptionString;
00117   }

00138   // default constructor
00139   Matrix::Matrix()
00140     :m_MatrixElement(m_Matrix)
00141   {
00142     if( !m_IsMTXInitialized )
00143     {
00144       if( !MTX_Initialize_MTXEngine() )
00145       {
00146         m_IsMTXInitialized = false;
00147         MatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to initialize the MTX Engine. Try commenting out #define MTX_SIMD_OPTIMIZED in cmatrix.h" );
00148       }
00149       else
00150       {
00151         m_IsMTXInitialized = true;
00152       }
00153     }
00154 
00155     MTX_Init( &m_Matrix );
00156   }
00157 
00158 
00159   // destructor
00160   Matrix::~Matrix()
00161   { 
00162     if( !m_IsMTXInitialized )
00163     {
00164       if( !MTX_Initialize_MTXEngine() )
00165       {
00166         m_IsMTXInitialized = false;
00167         MatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to initialize the MTX Engine. Try commenting out #define MTX_SIMD_OPTIMIZED in cmatrix.h" );
00168       }
00169       else
00170       {
00171         m_IsMTXInitialized = true;
00172       }
00173     }
00174 
00175     if( !MTX_Free( &m_Matrix ) )
00176     {
00177       MatrixError( "~Matrix", "Unable to free memory properly" );
00178     }
00179   }

00182   // vector style constructor
00183   Matrix::Matrix( const unsigned nrows )
00184     :m_MatrixElement(m_Matrix)
00185   { 
00186     if( !m_IsMTXInitialized )
00187     {
00188       if( !MTX_Initialize_MTXEngine() )
00189       {
00190         m_IsMTXInitialized = false;
00191         MatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to initialize the MTX Engine. Try commenting out #define MTX_SIMD_OPTIMIZED in cmatrix.h" );
00192       }
00193       else
00194       {
00195         m_IsMTXInitialized = true;
00196       }
00197     }
00198 
00199     MTX_Init( &m_Matrix );
00200     if( !MTX_Calloc( &m_Matrix, nrows, 1, true ) )
00201     {
00202       char msg[128];
00203 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
00204       sprintf_s( msg, 128, "Unable to allocate enough memory for Matrix as vector(%d)", nrows );
00205 #else
00206       sprintf( msg, "Unable to allocate enough memory for Matrix as vector(%d)", nrows );
00207 #endif
00208       MatrixError( "Matrix", msg );
00209     }
00210   }
00211 
00212 
00213   // matrix style constructor
00214   Matrix::Matrix( const unsigned nrows, const unsigned ncols, const bool isReal )
00215     :m_MatrixElement(m_Matrix)
00216   { 
00217     if( !m_IsMTXInitialized )
00218     {
00219       if( !MTX_Initialize_MTXEngine() )
00220       {
00221         m_IsMTXInitialized = false;
00222         MatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to initialize the MTX Engine. Try commenting out #define MTX_SIMD_OPTIMIZED in cmatrix.h" );
00223       }
00224       else
00225       {
00226         m_IsMTXInitialized = true;
00227       }
00228     }
00229 
00230     MTX_Init( &m_Matrix );
00231     if( !MTX_Calloc( &m_Matrix, nrows, ncols, isReal ) )
00232     {
00233       char msg[128];
00234 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
00235       if( isReal )
00236         sprintf_s( msg, 128, "Unable to allocate enough memory for Matrix(%d,%d)", nrows, ncols );
00237       else
00238         sprintf_s( msg, 128, "Unable to allocate enough memory for complex Matrix(%d,%d)", nrows, ncols );
00239 #else
00240       if( isReal )
00241         sprintf( msg, "Unable to allocate enough memory for Matrix(%d,%d)", nrows, ncols );
00242       else
00243         sprintf( msg, "Unable to allocate enough memory for complex Matrix(%d,%d)", nrows, ncols );
00244 #endif
00245 
00246       MatrixError( "Matrix", msg );
00247     }
00248   }

00251   // constructor reading data from file   
00252   Matrix::Matrix( const char* path, bool& itWorked )
00253     :m_MatrixElement(m_Matrix)
00254   {
00255     if( !m_IsMTXInitialized )
00256     {
00257       if( !MTX_Initialize_MTXEngine() )
00258       {
00259         m_IsMTXInitialized = false;
00260         MatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to initialize the MTX Engine. Try commenting out #define MTX_SIMD_OPTIMIZED in cmatrix.h" );
00261       }
00262       else
00263       {
00264         m_IsMTXInitialized = true;
00265       }
00266     }
00267 
00268     MTX_Init( &m_Matrix );
00269 
00270     if( MTX_ReadFromFile( &m_Matrix, path ) )
00271       itWorked = true;
00272     else
00273       itWorked = false;  
00274   }

00276   // copy constructor
00277   Matrix::Matrix( const Matrix& mat )
00278     :m_MatrixElement(m_Matrix)
00279   {
00280     MTX_Init( &m_Matrix );
00281     if( !MTX_Copy( &(mat.m_Matrix), &m_Matrix ) )
00282     {
00283       MatrixError( "Matrix", "Copy constructor failed to copy input matrix." );
00284     }
00285   }
00286 
00287   // copy from a static matrix
00288   Matrix::Matrix(const double mat[], const unsigned nrows, const unsigned ncols )
00289     :m_MatrixElement(m_Matrix)
00290   {
00291     MTX_Init( &m_Matrix );
00292     if( mat == NULL )
00293     {
00294       MatrixError( "Matrix", "Input static double array(matrix) pointer is NULL" );
00295     }
00296     if( !MTX_SetFromStaticMatrix( &m_Matrix, mat, nrows, ncols ) )
00297     {
00298       MatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to set the matrix from a static double array(matrix)" );
00299     }
00300   }

00302 
00303   // assignment operator (constructor)
00304   Matrix& Matrix::operator= (const Matrix& mat)
00305   {
00306     // trap assignment to self
00307     if( this == &mat )
00308       return *this;
00309 
00310     if( !MTX_Copy( &mat.m_Matrix, &m_Matrix ) )
00311     {
00312       MatrixError( "operator=", "Failed to copy input matrix" );
00313     }
00314 
00315     return *this;
00316   }
00317 
00318 
00319   Matrix& Matrix::operator= (const double value)
00320   {
00321     if( !MTX_Malloc( &m_Matrix, 1, 1, true ) )
00322     {
00323       MatrixError( "operator=double", "Unable to redimension to 1x1." );
00324     }
00325 
00326     if( !MTX_SetValue( &m_Matrix, 0, 0, value ) )
00327     {
00328       MatrixError( "operator=double", "Unable to set double value." );
00329     }
00330 
00331     return *this;
00332   }
00333 
00334   Matrix& Matrix::operator= (const std::complex<double> value)
00335   {
00336     if( !MTX_Malloc( &m_Matrix, 1, 1, false ) )
00337     {
00338       MatrixError( "operator=std::complex<double>", "Unable to redimension to 1x1." );
00339     }
00340 
00341     if( !MTX_SetComplexValue( &m_Matrix, 0, 0, value.real(), value.imag() ) )
00342     {
00343       MatrixError( "operator=std::complex<double>", "Unable to set the value." );
00344     }
00345 
00346     return *this;
00347   }
00348 
00349   Matrix& Matrix::operator=(const char* strMatrix)
00350   {
00351     if( !MTX_SetFromMatrixString( &m_Matrix, strMatrix ) )
00352     {
00353       MatrixError( "operator=string", "Unable to set matrix from the string specified." );
00354     }
00355     return *this;
00356   }

00381   {

00383   }
00384 
00385   // static
00386   void Matrix::StaticMatrixError( const char* function, const char* error )
00387   {
00388     char msg[256];
00389 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
00390     if( strstr(function,"operator") != NULL )
00391       sprintf_s( msg, 256, "\nMatrix::%s, Error:\n%s\n", function, error );   
00392     else
00393       sprintf_s( msg, 256, "\nMatrix::%s(), Error:\n%s\n", function, error );
00394 #else
00395     if( strstr(function,"operator") != NULL )
00396       sprintf( msg, "\nMatrix::%s, Error:\n%s\n", function, error );   
00397     else
00398       sprintf( msg, "\nMatrix::%s(), Error:\n%s\n", function, error );
00399 #endif
00400 
00401 
00402 #ifdef MATRIX_USE_EXCEPTION_HANDLING
00403 
00404     throw MatrixException(msg);
00405     return;
00406 
00407 #else
00408 
00409 #ifdef USING_MFC
00410     CString errMsg = msg;
00411     AfxMessageBox(errMsg);   
00412 #else
00413     printf( "%s\r\n", msg );   
00414 #endif
00415 
00416     // no choice but to call exit!
00417     exit(1);
00418 #endif    
00419   }

00484   double Matrix::real(const unsigned row, const unsigned col)
00485   {
00486     if( IndexCheck(row,col) )
00487     {
00488       if( m_Matrix.isReal )
00489       {
00490         return m_Matrix.data[col][row];
00491       }
00492       else
00493       {
00494         return m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].re;
00495       }
00496     }
00497     else
00498     {
00499       return 0.0;
00500     }
00501   }
00502 
00503   double Matrix::real(const unsigned index)
00504   {
00505     unsigned row = 0;
00506     unsigned col = 0;
00507 
00508     if( IndexCheck(index) )
00509     {
00510       if( m_Matrix.ncols == 1 )
00511       {
00512         row = index;
00513       }
00514       else if( m_Matrix.nrows == 1 )
00515       {
00516         col = index;
00517       }
00518       else
00519       {
00520         // access the matrix as a singular column array
00521         col = index / m_Matrix.nrows;
00522         row = index - col*m_Matrix.nrows;
00523       }
00524       if( m_Matrix.isReal )
00525       {
00526         return m_Matrix.data[col][row];
00527       }
00528       else
00529       {
00530         return m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].re;
00531       }
00532     }
00533     else
00534     {
00535       return 0.0;
00536     }
00537   }
00538 
00539   double Matrix::imag(const unsigned row, const unsigned col)
00540   {
00541     if( IndexCheck(row,col) )
00542     {
00543       if( m_Matrix.isReal )
00544       {
00545         return 0.0;
00546       }
00547       else
00548       {
00549         return m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].im;
00550       }
00551     }
00552     else
00553     {
00554       return 0.0;
00555     }
00556   }
00557 
00558   double Matrix::imag(const unsigned index)
00559   {
00560     unsigned row = 0;
00561     unsigned col = 0;
00562 
00563     if( IndexCheck(index) )
00564     {
00565       if( m_Matrix.ncols == 1 )
00566       {
00567         row = index;
00568       }
00569       else if( m_Matrix.nrows == 1 )
00570       {
00571         col = index;
00572       }
00573       else
00574       {
00575         // access the matrix as a singular column array
00576         col = index / m_Matrix.nrows;
00577         row = index - col*m_Matrix.nrows;
00578       }
00579       if( m_Matrix.isReal )
00580       {
00581         return 0.0;
00582       }
00583       else
00584       {
00585         return m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].im;
00586       }
00587     }
00588     else
00589     {
00590       return 0.0;
00591     }
00592   }

00595   /// Is this a real matrix for accessing by (row,col) operator? e.g. double d = A(0,4).
00596   bool Matrix::isReal() const
00597   {
00598     if( m_Matrix.isReal )
00599       return true;
00600     else
00601       return false;
00602   }

00604   /// Is this a complex matrix for accessing by [row][col] operators? e.g. stComplex d = A[0][4].
00605   bool Matrix::isComplex() const
00606   {
00607     if( m_Matrix.isReal )
00608       return false;
00609     else
00610       return true;
00611   }

00630   bool Matrix::Copy( const double& value )
00631   {
00632     if( !MTX_Malloc( &m_Matrix, 1, 1, true ) )
00633       return false;
00634 
00635     if( MTX_SetValue( &m_Matrix, 0, 0, value ) )
00636       return true;
00637     else
00638       return false;
00639   }
00640 
00641   bool Matrix::Copy( const std::complex<double>& cplx )
00642   {
00643     if( !MTX_Malloc( &m_Matrix, 1, 1, false ) )
00644       return false;
00645 
00646     if( MTX_SetComplexValue( &m_Matrix, 0, 0, cplx.real(), cplx.imag() ) )
00647       return true;
00648     else
00649       return false;
00650   }

01288   bool Matrix::Inplace_ones( const unsigned nrows, const unsigned ncols )
01289   {
01290     if( m_Matrix.nrows == nrows && m_Matrix.ncols == ncols && m_Matrix.isReal )
01291     { 
01292       if( !MTX_Fill( &m_Matrix, 1.0 ) )
01293         return false;
01294     }
01295     else
01296     {
01297       if( !MTX_Malloc( &m_Matrix, nrows, ncols, TRUE ) )
01298         return false;
01299       if( !MTX_Fill( &m_Matrix, 1.0 ) )
01300         return false;
01301     }
01302     return true;
01303   }
01304

01329   bool Matrix::Inplace_zeros( const unsigned nrows, const unsigned ncols )
01330   {
01331     if( m_Matrix.nrows == nrows && m_Matrix.ncols == ncols && m_Matrix.isReal )
01332     { 
01333       if( !MTX_Fill( &m_Matrix, 0.0 ) )
01334         return false;
01335     }
01336     else
01337     {
01338       if( !MTX_Malloc( &m_Matrix, nrows, ncols, TRUE ) )
01339         return false;
01340       if( !MTX_Fill( &m_Matrix, 0.0 ) )
01341         return false;
01342     }
01343     return true;
01344   }

01756   bool Matrix::GetLUFactorization( bool &isFullRank, Matrix &P, Matrix &L, Matrix &U )
01757   {
01758     BOOL b_isFullRank;
01759     if( MTX_LUFactorization( &m_Matrix, &b_isFullRank, &P.m_Matrix, &L.m_Matrix, &U.m_Matrix ) )
01760     {
01761       if( b_isFullRank )
01762         isFullRank = true;
01763       else
01764         isFullRank = false;
01765 
01766       return true;
01767     }
01768     else 
01769     {
01770       if( b_isFullRank )
01771         isFullRank = true;
01772       else
01773         isFullRank = false;
01774 
01775       return false;
01776     }
01777   }
01778 
01779   bool Matrix::GetIndexedValues( Matrix& RowIndex, Matrix& ColIndex, Matrix& Result )
01780   {
01781     Matrix _rowIndex; // a copy if needed
01782     Matrix _colIndex; // a copy if needed
01783     if( !RowIndex.m_Matrix.isReal )
01784     {
01785       if( !MTX_Real( &RowIndex.m_Matrix, &_rowIndex.m_Matrix ) )
01786         return false;
01787     }
01788     if( !ColIndex.m_Matrix.isReal )
01789     {
01790       if( !MTX_Real( &ColIndex.m_Matrix, &_colIndex.m_Matrix ) )
01791         return false;
01792     }
01793 
01794     if( !_rowIndex.isEmpty() )
01795     {
01796       if( !_colIndex.isEmpty() )
01797       {
01798         if( MTX_IndexedValues( &m_Matrix, &_rowIndex.m_Matrix, &_colIndex.m_Matrix, &Result.m_Matrix ) )
01799           return true;
01800         else
01801           return false;
01802       }
01803       else
01804       {
01805         if( MTX_IndexedValues( &m_Matrix, &_rowIndex.m_Matrix, &ColIndex.m_Matrix, &Result.m_Matrix ) )
01806           return true;
01807         else
01808           return false;
01809       }
01810     }
01811     else
01812     {
01813       if( !_colIndex.isEmpty() )
01814       {
01815         if( MTX_IndexedValues( &m_Matrix, &RowIndex.m_Matrix, &_colIndex.m_Matrix, &Result.m_Matrix ) )
01816           return true;
01817         else
01818           return false;
01819       }
01820       else
01821       {
01822         if( MTX_IndexedValues( &m_Matrix, &RowIndex.m_Matrix, &ColIndex.m_Matrix, &Result.m_Matrix ) )
01823           return true;
01824         else
01825           return false;
01826       }
01827     }    
01828   }
01829 
01830   std::string Matrix::GetMatrixComment()
01831   {
01832     std::string result;
01833     if( m_Matrix.comment != NULL )
01834       result = m_Matrix.comment;
01835     
01836     return result;
01837   }

01840   bool Matrix::TimeWindow( 
01841     const unsigned timeColumn, //!< The column containing time.
01842     const double startTime,    //!< The specified start time (inclusive).
01843     const double duration,     //!< The duration to include.
01844     const double rolloverTime  //!< The potential time at which system time rolls over.
01845     )
01846   {
01847     if( MTX_TimeWindow(
01848       &m_Matrix, 
01849       timeColumn, 
01850       startTime,
01851       duration,
01852       rolloverTime ) )
01853       return true;
01854     else 
01855       return false;
01856   }
01857 
01858   bool Matrix::TimeLimit( 
01859     const unsigned timeColumn, //!< The column containing time
01860     const double startTime,    //!< The specified start time (inclusive)
01861     const double endTime       //!< The duration to include
01862     )
01863   {
01864     if( MTX_TimeLimit(
01865       &m_Matrix,
01866       timeColumn,
01867       startTime,
01868       endTime ) )
01869       return true;
01870     else 
01871       return false;
01872   }
01873 
01874   bool Matrix::TimeMatch( 
01875     Matrix &A,                   //!< The matrix with interpolation times
01876     const unsigned timeColumnA,  //!< The zero based column index for matrix A
01877     Matrix &B,                   //!< The matrix to be interpolated
01878     const unsigned timeColumnB,  //!< The zero based column index for matrix B
01879     const unsigned precision,    //!< The rounding precision used for time matching, 0 = whole, 1 = 0.1, 2 = 0.01, etc
01880     const double rolloverTime    //!< The rollover time, e.g. 60 s for minute based timing, 0.0 means rollovers not allowed
01881     )
01882   {
01883     // check that the mtx engine is initialized
01884     if( !m_IsMTXInitialized )
01885     {
01886       if( !MTX_Initialize_MTXEngine() )
01887       {
01888         m_IsMTXInitialized = false;
01889         StaticMatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to initialize the MTX Engine. Try commenting out #define MTX_SIMD_OPTIMIZED in cmatrix.h" );
01890       }
01891       else
01892       {
01893         m_IsMTXInitialized = true;
01894       }
01895     }
01896 
01897     if( MTX_TimeMatch(
01898       &A.m_Matrix,
01899       timeColumnA,
01900       &B.m_Matrix,
01901       timeColumnB,
01902       precision,
01903       rolloverTime ) )
01904       return true;
01905     else 
01906       return false;
01907   }
01908 
01909   bool Matrix::Interpolate( 
01910     Matrix &A,                    //!< The matrix with interpolation times
01911     const unsigned timeColumnA,   //!< The zero based column index for matrix A
01912     Matrix &B,                    //!< The matrix to be interpolated
01913     const unsigned timeColumnB,   //!< The zero based column index for matrix B
01914     const double maxInterpolationInterval, //!< The largest interpolation interval allowed
01915     const double rolloverTime     //!< The rollover time, e.g. 60 s for minute based timing, 0.0 means rollovers not allowed
01916     )
01917   {
01918     // check that the mtx engine is initialized
01919     if( !m_IsMTXInitialized )
01920     {
01921       if( !MTX_Initialize_MTXEngine() )
01922       {
01923         m_IsMTXInitialized = false;
01924         StaticMatrixError( "Matrix", "Failed to initialize the MTX Engine. Try commenting out #define MTX_SIMD_OPTIMIZED in cmatrix.h" );
01925       }
01926       else
01927       {
01928         m_IsMTXInitialized = true;
01929       }
01930     }
01931 
01932     if( MTX_Interpolate(
01933       &A.m_Matrix,
01934       timeColumnA,
01935       &B.m_Matrix,
01936       timeColumnB,
01937       maxInterpolationInterval,
01938       rolloverTime ) )
01939       return true;
01940     else 
01941       return false;
01942   }

01946   // Return the column matrix specified by the column index. Returns (nrows x 1).
01947   Matrix  Matrix::Column(const unsigned col)
01948   {
01949     Matrix A;
01950     if( !MTX_CopyColumn( &m_Matrix, col, &A.m_Matrix ) )
01951     {
01952       MatrixError( "Column", "Unable to copy the source matrix column." );
01953     }
01954     return A;
01955   }
01956 
01957   // Return the row matrix specified by the column index. Returns (ncols x 1).
01958   Matrix  Matrix::Row(const unsigned row)
01959   {
01960     Matrix A;
01961     if( !MTX_CopyRow(&m_Matrix, row, &A.m_Matrix ) )
01962     {
01963       MatrixError( "Column", "Unable to copy the source matrix column." );
01964     }
01965     return A;
01966   }
01967 
01968   // Return the tranpose of the matrix.
01969   Matrix  Matrix::Transpose()
01970   {
01971     Matrix A;
01972     if( !MTX_Transpose( &m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
01973     {
01974       MatrixError( "Column", "Unable to transpose the source matrix." );
01975     }
01976     return A;
01977   }
01978 
01979   // Return the tranpose of the matrix.
01980   Matrix  Matrix::T()
01981   {
01982     return Transpose();
01983   }
01984 
01985   // Return the diagonal of the matrix as a vector.
01986   Matrix  Matrix::Diagonal()
01987   {
01988     Matrix A;
01989     if( !MTX_Diagonal( &m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
01990     {
01991       MatrixError( "Diagonal", "Unable to get the diagonal of the source matrix." );
01992     }
01993     return A;
01994   }
01995 
01996   // Return the inverse of the matrix.
01997   Matrix  Matrix::Inverse()
01998   {
01999     Matrix A;
02000     if( !MTX_Copy( &m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
02001     {
02002       MatrixError( "Inverse", "Unable to copy the source matrix." );
02003     }
02004     if( !MTX_InvertInPlace( &A.m_Matrix ) )
02005     {
02006       MatrixError( "Inverse", "Unable to invert the matrix." );
02007     }
02008     return A;
02009   }
02010 
02011   // Return the inverse of the matrix.
02012   Matrix  Matrix::Inv()// short version
02013   {
02014     return Inverse();
02015   }
02016 
02017   // Return the Fourier Transform of each column of the matrix. Power of two uses FFT, otherwise fast DFT.
02018   Matrix  Matrix::FFT()
02019   {
02020     Matrix A;
02021     if( !MTX_FFT( &m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
02022     {
02023       MatrixError( "FFT", "Unable to perform the FFT." );
02024     }
02025     return A;
02026   }
02027 
02028   // Return the inverse Fourier Transform of each column of the matrix. Power of two uses IFFT, otherwise fast IDFT.
02029   Matrix  Matrix::IFFT()
02030   {
02031     Matrix A;
02032     if( !MTX_IFFT( &m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
02033     {
02034       MatrixError( "IFFT", "Unable to perform the IFFT." );
02035     }
02036     return A;
02037   }

02040 
02041   /// Get a reference to an element in the matrix to set its value.
02042   Matrix::Element& Matrix::operator() (unsigned row, unsigned col)
02043   {
02044     if( IndexCheck(row,col) )
02045     {
02046       m_MatrixElement.m_row = row;
02047       m_MatrixElement.m_col = col;
02048     }
02049     else
02050     {
02051       // This code should not be reached!
02052       m_MatrixElement.m_row = 0;
02053       m_MatrixElement.m_col = 0;
02054     }
02055     return m_MatrixElement; 
02056   }
02057 
02058 
02059   /// Get a reference to an element in the matrix as a column or row vector to set its value.
02060   Matrix::Element& Matrix::operator() (unsigned index)
02061   {
02062     if( IndexCheck( index ) )
02063     {
02064       if( m_Matrix.ncols == 1 ) // column array
02065       {
02066         m_MatrixElement.m_row = index;
02067         m_MatrixElement.m_col = 0;
02068       }
02069       else if( m_Matrix.nrows == 1 ) // row array
02070       {
02071         m_MatrixElement.m_row = 0;
02072         m_MatrixElement.m_col = index;
02073       }
02074       else
02075       {
02076         // access the matrix as a singular column array
02077         m_MatrixElement.m_col = index / m_Matrix.nrows;
02078         m_MatrixElement.m_row = index - m_MatrixElement.m_col*m_Matrix.nrows;
02079       }
02080     }
02081     else
02082     {
02083       // This code should not be reached!
02084       m_MatrixElement.m_row = 0;
02085       m_MatrixElement.m_col = 0;
02086     }
02087 
02088     return m_MatrixElement;
02089   }
02090 
02091 
02092   Matrix::Element::Element(MTX& mtx)
02093     : m_mtx(mtx), m_row(0), m_col(0)
02094   {
02095     // Note that there is no index checking at this level. The 
02096     // index checking is performed at the Matrix operator() level.
02097   }
02098 
02099   Matrix::Element::~Element()
02100   {}
02101 
02102   const double Matrix::Element::real()
02103   {
02104     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02105     {
02106       return m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row];
02107     }
02108     else
02109     {
02110       return m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re;
02111     }
02112   }
02113   
02114   const double Matrix::Element::imag()
02115   {
02116     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02117     {
02118       return 0.0;
02119     }
02120     else
02121     {
02122       return m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im;
02123     }
02124   }
02125 
02126   const Matrix::Element& Matrix::Element::operator= (double v)
02127   {
02128     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02129     {
02130       m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] = v;
02131     }
02132     else
02133     {
02134       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re = v;
02135       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im = 0.0;
02136     }
02137     return *this;
02138   }
02139   
02140   const Matrix::Element& Matrix::Element::operator= (std::complex<double> v)
02141   {
02142     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02143     {
02144       if( v.imag() != 0.0 )
02145       {
02146         // This is on the fly conversion to a complex matrix!
02147         if( !MTX_ConvertRealToComplex( &m_mtx ) )
02148         {
02149           MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02150           Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element::operator=", "Unable to convert matrix from real to complex" );
02151           return *this;
02152         }
02153       }
02154       else
02155       {
02156         m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] = v.real();
02157         return *this;
02158       }
02159     }
02160     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re = v.real();
02161     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im = v.imag();
02162     return *this;
02163   }
02164 
02165   const Matrix::Element& Matrix::Element::operator= (Element v)
02166   {
02167     if( v.m_mtx.isReal )
02168     {
02169       if( m_mtx.isReal )
02170       {
02171         m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] = v.m_mtx.data[v.m_col][v.m_row];
02172       }
02173       else
02174       {
02175         m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re = v.m_mtx.data[v.m_col][v.m_row];
02176         m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im = 0.0;
02177       }
02178     }
02179     else
02180     {
02181       if( m_mtx.isReal )
02182       {
02183         // This is on the fly conversion to a complex matrix!
02184         if( !MTX_ConvertRealToComplex( &m_mtx ) )
02185         {
02186           MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02187           Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element::operator=", "Unable to convert matrix from real to complex" );
02188           return *this;
02189         }        
02190       }
02191       
02192       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re = v.m_mtx.cplx[v.m_col][v.m_row].re;
02193       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im = v.m_mtx.cplx[v.m_col][v.m_row].im;      
02194     }
02195     return *this;
02196   }
02197 
02198 
02199   Matrix::Element::operator const std::complex<double>() const
02200   {
02201     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02202     {
02203       std::complex<double> v( m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row], 0.0 );
02204       return v;
02205     }
02206     else
02207     {
02208       std::complex<double> v( m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re, m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im );
02209       return v;
02210     }
02211   }
02212 
02213 
02214   void Matrix::Element::operator+= (const double scalar)
02215   {
02216     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02217     {
02218       m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] += scalar;
02219     }
02220     else
02221     {
02222       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re += scalar;
02223     }
02224   }
02225 
02226   void Matrix::Element::operator+= (const std::complex<double>& v)
02227   {
02228     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02229     {
02230       if( v.imag() != 0.0 )
02231       {
02232         // This is on the fly conversion to a complex matrix!
02233         if( !MTX_ConvertRealToComplex( &m_mtx ) )
02234         {
02235           MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02236           Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element::operator=", "Unable to convert matrix from real to complex" );
02237           return;
02238         }
02239       }
02240       else
02241       {
02242         m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] += v.real();
02243         return;
02244       }
02245     }
02246     
02247     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re += v.real();
02248     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im += v.imag();    
02249   }
02250   
02251   void Matrix::Element::operator+= (const Element& v)
02252   {
02253     std::complex<double> cplx = (const std::complex<double>)v;
02254     *this += cplx;
02255   }
02256 
02257 
02258   void Matrix::Element::operator-= (const double scalar)
02259   {
02260     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02261     {
02262       m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] -= scalar;
02263     }
02264     else
02265     {
02266       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re -= scalar;
02267     }
02268   }
02269 
02270   void Matrix::Element::operator-= (const std::complex<double>& v)
02271   {
02272     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02273     {
02274       if( v.imag() != 0.0 )
02275       {
02276         // This is on the fly conversion to a complex matrix!
02277         if( !MTX_ConvertRealToComplex( &m_mtx ) )
02278         {
02279           MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02280           Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element::operator=", "Unable to convert matrix from real to complex" );
02281           return;
02282         }
02283       }
02284       else
02285       {
02286         m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] -= v.real();
02287         return;
02288       }
02289     }
02290     
02291     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re -= v.real();
02292     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im -= v.imag();    
02293   }
02294   
02295   void Matrix::Element::operator-= (const Element& v)
02296   {
02297     std::complex<double> cplx = (const std::complex<double>)v;
02298     *this -= cplx;
02299   }
02300 
02301 
02302   void Matrix::Element::operator*= (const double scalar)
02303   {
02304     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02305     {
02306       m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] *= scalar;
02307     }
02308     else
02309     {
02310       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re *= scalar;
02311       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im *= scalar;
02312     }
02313   }
02314 
02315   void Matrix::Element::operator*= (const std::complex<double>& v)
02316   {
02317     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02318     {
02319       if( v.imag() != 0.0 )
02320       {
02321         // This is on the fly conversion to a complex matrix!
02322         if( !MTX_ConvertRealToComplex( &m_mtx ) )
02323         {
02324           MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02325           Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element::operator=", "Unable to convert matrix from real to complex" );
02326           return;
02327         }
02328       }
02329       else
02330       {
02331         m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] *= v.real();
02332         return;
02333       }
02334     }
02335 
02336     double re = m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re;
02337     double im = m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im;
02338     
02339     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re = re*v.real() - im*v.imag();
02340     m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im = re*v.imag() + im*v.real();    
02341   }
02342   
02343   void Matrix::Element::operator*= (const Element& v)
02344   {
02345     std::complex<double> cplx = (const std::complex<double>)v;
02346     *this *= cplx;
02347   }
02348 
02349 
02350   void Matrix::Element::operator/= (const double scalar)
02351   {
02352     if( scalar == 0.0 )
02353     {
02354       MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02355       Matrix::StaticMatrixError("Element/=","Divide by zero!");
02356     }
02357     else
02358     {
02359       if( m_mtx.isReal )
02360       {
02361         m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] /= scalar;
02362       }
02363       else
02364       {
02365         m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re /= scalar;
02366         m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im /= scalar;
02367       }
02368     }
02369   }
02370 
02371   void Matrix::Element::operator/= (const std::complex<double>& v)
02372   {
02373     if( m_mtx.isReal )
02374     {
02375       if( v.imag() == 0.0 )
02376       {
02377         if( v.real() == 0.0 )
02378         {
02379           MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02380           Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element/=", "Divide by zero." );
02381           return;
02382         }
02383         else
02384         {
02385           m_mtx.data[m_col][m_row] /= v.real();
02386           return;
02387         }
02388       }
02389       else
02390       {
02391         // This is on the fly conversion to a complex matrix!
02392         if( !MTX_ConvertRealToComplex( &m_mtx ) )
02393         {
02394           MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02395           Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element/=", "Unable to convert matrix from real to complex" );
02396           return;
02397         }
02398       }
02399     }
02400 
02401     double d = v.real()*v.real() + v.imag()*v.imag(); 
02402     if( d == 0.0 )
02403     { 
02404       MTX_Free( &m_mtx );
02405       Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "Element/=", "Divide by zero." );
02406     }
02407     else
02408     {
02409       double r = m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re;
02410       double i = m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im;
02411       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].re = (r * v.real() + i * v.imag()) / d;
02412       m_mtx.cplx[m_col][m_row].im = (i * v.real() - r * v.imag()) / d;
02413     }
02414   }
02415   
02416   void Matrix::Element::operator/= (const Element& v)
02417   {
02418     std::complex<double> cplx = (const std::complex<double>)v;
02419     *this /= cplx;
02420   }
02421

02432     v += scalar;
02433     return v;

02601 
02602 
02603   //friend 
02604   const bool operator== (const Matrix::Element& m, double scalar)
02605   {
02606     if( m.m_mtx.isReal )
02607     {
02608       if( m.m_mtx.data[m.m_col][m.m_row] == scalar )
02609         return true;
02610       else
02611         return false;
02612     }
02613     else
02614     {
02615       if( m.m_mtx.cplx[m.m_col][m.m_row].im != 0.0 )
02616         return false;
02617       if( m.m_mtx.cplx[m.m_col][m.m_row].re == scalar )
02618         return true;
02619       else
02620         return false;
02621     }
02622   }
02623   
02624   //friend 
02625   const bool operator== (const Matrix::Element& a, const Matrix::Element& b)
02626   {
02627     if( a.m_mtx.isReal )
02628     {
02629       if( b.m_mtx.isReal )
02630       {
02631         if( a.m_mtx.data[a.m_col][a.m_row] == b.m_mtx.data[b.m_col][b.m_row] )
02632           return true;
02633         else
02634           return false;
02635       }
02636       else
02637       {
02638         if( b.m_mtx.cplx[a.m_col][a.m_row].im != 0.0 )
02639           return false;
02640         if( a.m_mtx.data[a.m_col][a.m_row] == b.m_mtx.cplx[b.m_col][b.m_row].re )
02641           return true;
02642         else
02643           return false;
02644       }
02645     }
02646     else
02647     {
02648       if( b.m_mtx.isReal )
02649       {
02650         if( a.m_mtx.cplx[a.m_col][a.m_row].im != 0.0 )
02651           return false;
02652         if( a.m_mtx.cplx[a.m_col][a.m_row].re == b.m_mtx.data[b.m_col][b.m_row] )
02653           return true;
02654         else
02655           return false;
02656       }
02657       else
02658       {
02659         if( a.m_mtx.cplx[a.m_col][a.m_row].re == b.m_mtx.cplx[b.m_col][b.m_row].re &&
02660           a.m_mtx.cplx[a.m_col][a.m_row].im == b.m_mtx.cplx[b.m_col][b.m_row].im )
02661           return true;
02662         else
02663           return false;
02664       }
02665     }
02666   }
02667 
02668   //friend 
02669   const bool operator== (const Matrix::Element& a, const std::complex<double>& b)
02670   {
02671     if( a.m_mtx.isReal )
02672     {
02673       if( b.imag() != 0.0 )
02674         return false;
02675       if( a.m_mtx.data[a.m_col][a.m_row] == b.real() )
02676         return true;
02677       else
02678         return false;
02679     }
02680     else
02681     {
02682       if( a.m_mtx.cplx[a.m_col][a.m_row].re == b.real() && a.m_mtx.cplx[a.m_col][a.m_row].im == b.imag() )
02683         return true;
02684       else
02685         return false;
02686     }
02687   }
02688 
02689   //friend 
02690   const bool operator== (double scalar, const Matrix::Element& m)
02691   {
02692     return (m==scalar);
02693   }
02694       
02695   //friend 
02696   const bool operator== (const std::complex<double>& b, const Matrix::Element& a)
02697   {
02698     return (a==b);
02699   }

02704   {

02706   }

02709   {
02710     return Inplace_AddScalarComplex( cplx );
02711   }

02714   {
02715     return Inplace_SubtractScalar( scalar );
02716   }

02719   {
02720     return Inplace_SubtractScalarComplex( cplx );
02721   }

02724   {
02725     return Inplace_MultiplyScalar( scalar );
02726   }
02727 
02728   bool Matrix::operator*= (const std::complex<double> cplx)
02729   {
02730     return Inplace_MultiplyScalarComplex( cplx );
02731   }

02734   {
02735     return Inplace_DivideScalar( scalar );
02736   }

02739   {
02740     return Inplace_DivideScalarComplex( cplx );
02741   }

02743   bool Matrix::operator+= (const Matrix& mat)
02744   {
02745     return Inplace_Add( mat );
02746   }
02747 
02748   bool Matrix::operator-= (const Matrix& mat)
02749   {
02750     return Inplace_Subtract( mat );
02751   }
02752 
02753   /* friend */
02754   Matrix operator++ (Matrix& mat, int)
02755   {
02756     if( !mat.Inplace_Increment() )
02757     {
02758       mat.MatrixError( "operator++", "Inplace_Increment() returned false." );
02759       return mat;
02760     }
02761     return mat;
02762   }
02763 
02764   /* friend */
02765   Matrix operator-- (Matrix& mat, int)
02766   {
02767     if( !mat.Inplace_Decrement() )
02768     {
02769       mat.MatrixError( "operator--", "Inplace_Decrement() returned false." );
02770       return mat;
02771     }
02772     return mat;
02773   }
02774 
02775   // matrix multiplication: A = B * C
02776   /* friend */
02777   Matrix operator* (Matrix& mat1, Matrix& mat2)
02778   {
02779     Matrix A;
02780     if( !MTX_Multiply( &A.m_Matrix, &mat1.m_Matrix, &mat2.m_Matrix ) )
02781     {
02782       mat1.Clear();
02783       mat2.MatrixError( "operator*", "MTX_Multiply() returned false." );
02784       return A;
02785     }
02786     return A; // return a copy
02787   }
02788   
02789   Matrix operator* (const Matrix& mat1, const Matrix& mat2)
02790   {
02791     Matrix A;
02792     if( !MTX_Multiply( &A.m_Matrix, &mat1.m_Matrix, &mat2.m_Matrix ) )
02793     {
02794       Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "operator*", "MTX_Multiply() returned false." );
02795       return A;
02796     }
02797     return A; // return a copy
02798   }
02799

02802   // matrix addition: A = B + C
02803   /* friend */ 
02804   Matrix operator+ (Matrix& mat1, Matrix& mat2)
02805   {
02806     Matrix A;
02807     if( !MTX_Add( &A.m_Matrix, &mat1.m_Matrix, &mat2.m_Matrix ) )
02808     {
02809       mat1.Clear();
02810       mat2.MatrixError( "operator+", "MTX_Add() returned false." );
02811       return A;
02812     }
02813     return A; // return a copy
02814   }
02815   
02816   Matrix operator+ (const Matrix& mat1, const Matrix& mat2)
02817   {
02818     Matrix A;
02819     if( !MTX_Add( &A.m_Matrix, &mat1.m_Matrix, &mat2.m_Matrix ) )
02820     {
02821       Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "operator+", "MTX_Add() returned false." );
02822       return A;
02823     }
02824     return A; // return a copy
02825   }

02829   // matrix subtraction: A = B - C
02830   /* friend */ 
02831   Matrix operator- (Matrix& mat1, Matrix& mat2)
02832   {
02833     Matrix A;
02834     if( !MTX_Subtract( &A.m_Matrix, &mat1.m_Matrix, &mat2.m_Matrix ) )
02835     {
02836       mat1.Clear();
02837       mat2.MatrixError( "operator-", "MTX_Subtract() returned false." );
02838       return A;
02839     }
02840 
02841     return A; // return a copy
02842   }
02843   
02844   Matrix operator- (const Matrix& mat1, const Matrix& mat2)
02845   {
02846     Matrix A;
02847     if( !MTX_Subtract( &A.m_Matrix, &mat1.m_Matrix, &mat2.m_Matrix ) )
02848     {
02849       Matrix::StaticMatrixError( "operator-", "MTX_Subtract() returned false." );
02850       return A;
02851     }
02852 
02853     return A; // return a copy
02854   }

02856 
02857   // raise each element to a power
02858   /* friend */ 
02859   Matrix operator^ (Matrix& mat, const double scalar)
02860   {
02861     Matrix A;
02862     if( !MTX_Pow( &mat.m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix, scalar, 0.0 ) )
02863     {
02864       mat.MatrixError( "operator^", "MTX_Pow() returned false." );
02865       return A;
02866     }
02867 
02868     return A; // return a copy
02869   }
02870 
02871   /* friend */ 
02872   Matrix operator+ (const double scalar, Matrix& mat)
02873   {
02874     Matrix A;
02875     if( !MTX_Copy( &mat.m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
02876     {
02877       mat.MatrixError( "operator+", "MTX_Copy() returned false." );
02878       return A;
02879     }
02880 
02881     if( !A.Inplace_AddScalar( scalar ) )
02882     {
02883       mat.MatrixError( "Matrix operator+", "Inplace_AddScalar() returned false" );
02884       return A;
02885     }
02886 
02887     return A; // return a copy
02888   }
02889 
02890   /* friend */ 
02891   Matrix operator- (const double scalar, Matrix& mat)
02892   {
02893     Matrix A;
02894 
02895     if( !A.Redim( mat.GetNrRows(), mat.GetNrCols() ) )
02896     {
02897       mat.MatrixError( "operator-", "Redim() returned false." );
02898       return A;
02899     }
02900 
02901     if( !A.Fill( scalar ) )
02902     {
02903       mat.MatrixError( "operator-", "Fill() returned false." );
02904       return A;
02905     }
02906 
02907     if( !A.Inplace_Subtract( mat ) )
02908     {
02909       mat.MatrixError( "operator-", "Fill() returned false." );
02910       return A;
02911     }
02912 
02913     return A; // return a copy
02914   }
02915 
02916 
02917   /* friend */ 
02918   Matrix operator* (const double scalar, Matrix& mat)
02919   {
02920     Matrix A;
02921     if( !MTX_Copy( &mat.m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
02922     {
02923       mat.MatrixError( "operator*", "MTX_Copy() returned false." );
02924       return A;
02925     }
02926 
02927     if( !A.Inplace_MultiplyScalar( scalar ) )
02928     {
02929       mat.MatrixError( "operator*", "Inplace_MultiplyScalar() returned false." );
02930       return A;
02931     }
02932 
02933     return A;
02934   }
02935 
02936   /* friend */ 
02937   Matrix operator/ (Matrix& mat, const double scalar)
02938   {
02939     Matrix A;
02940     if( !MTX_Copy( &mat.m_Matrix, &A.m_Matrix ) )
02941     {
02942       mat.MatrixError( "operator/", "MTX_Copy() returned false." );
02943       return A;
02944     }
02945 
02946     if( !A.Inplace_DivideScalar( scalar ) )
02947     {
02948       mat.MatrixError( "operator/", "Inplace_DivideScalar() returned false." );
02949       return A;
02950     }
02951 
02952     return A;
02953   }
02954 
02955   /* friend */ 
02956   Matrix operator/ (const double scalar, Matrix& mat)
02957   {
02958     Matrix A;
02959     if( !A.Redim( mat.GetNrRows(), mat.GetNrCols() ) )
02960     {
02961       mat.MatrixError( "operator/", "Redim() returned false." );
02962       return A;
02963     }
02964 
02965     if( !A.Fill( scalar ) )
02966     {
02967       mat.MatrixError( "operator/", "Fill() returned false." );
02968       return A;
02969     }
02970 
02971     if( !A.Inplace_DotDivide( mat ) )
02972     {
02973       mat.MatrixError( "operator/", "Inplace_DotDivide() returned false." );
02974       return A;
02975     }
02976 
02977     return A; // return a copy
02978   }
02979 
02980 
02981 
02982

02985   //
02986 #ifdef MATRIX_STREAM_SUPPORT
02987 
02988   // output of a matrix: cout << A;
02989   /* friend */ 
02990   ostream& operator<< (ostream& strm, const Matrix& mat)
02991   {
02992     mat.Print( strm, strm.precision(), strm.width() );
02993     return strm;
02994   }

02996 #endif

03000 
03001   bool Matrix::IndexCheck( const unsigned row, const unsigned col )
03002   {
03003     if( MTX_isNull(&m_Matrix) || row >= m_Matrix.nrows || col >= m_Matrix.ncols )
03004     {
03005       char msga[128];
03006 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
03007       sprintf_s( msga, 128, "Matrix access violation (%d,%d) out of bounds (%d,%d).\n", row, col, m_Matrix.nrows, m_Matrix.ncols );
03008 #else
03009       sprintf( msga, "Matrix access violation (%d,%d) out of bounds (%d,%d).\n", row, col, m_Matrix.nrows, m_Matrix.ncols );
03010 #endif
03011       MatrixError( "IndexCheck", msga );
03012       return false;
03013     }
03014     return true;
03015   }
03016 
03017   bool Matrix::IndexCheck( const unsigned index )
03018   {
03019     unsigned n = 0; // The number of elements as a vector.
03020     if( MTX_isNull(&m_Matrix) )
03021       n = 0;
03022     else
03023       n = m_Matrix.nrows*m_Matrix.ncols;
03024 
03025     if( index >= n )
03026     {
03027       char msga[128];
03028 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
03029       sprintf_s( msga, 128, "Matrix access violation (%d) out of bounds (%dx%d).\n", index, m_Matrix.nrows, m_Matrix.ncols );
03030 #else
03031       sprintf( msga, "Matrix access violation (%d) out of bounds (%dx%d).\n", index, m_Matrix.nrows, m_Matrix.ncols );
03032 #endif
03033       MatrixError( "IndexCheck", msga );
03034       return false;
03035     }
03036     return true;
03037   }

03054 #ifndef _CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
03055       sprintf_s( msga, 128, "Matrix access violation [%d][%d] out of bounds (%d,%d).\n", row, col, m_Matrix.nrows, m_Matrix.ncols );
03056 #else
03057       sprintf( msga, "Matrix access violation (%d,%d) out of bounds (%d,%d).\n", row, col, m_Matrix.nrows, m_Matrix.ncols );
03058 #endif

03060       return false;

03062     return true;

03069       n = 0;
03070     else
03071       n = m_Matrix.nrows*m_Matrix.ncols;

03086 
03087   double& Matrix::RealOnlyAccess::operator [] (const unsigned col)
03088   { 
03089     if( IndexCheck( m_row, col ) )
03090     {
03091       if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03092       {
03093         return m_Matrix.data[col][m_row];
03094       }
03095       else
03096       {
03097         return m_Matrix.cplx[col][m_row].re;
03098       }
03099     }
03100     else
03101     {
03102       staticglobal_BadDouble = 0.0;
03103       return staticglobal_BadDouble;
03104     }    
03105   }
03106 
03107   Matrix::RealOnlyAccess Matrix::operator[] (const unsigned row)
03108   {
03109     return RealOnlyAccess( m_Matrix, row );
03110   }
03111 
03112   Matrix::RealOnlyAccess& Matrix::RealOnlyAccess::operator=(const double value)
03113   {
03114     // This is indexing the matrix as a vector.
03115     const unsigned index = m_row;
03116     if( IndexCheck(index) )
03117     {
03118       if( m_Matrix.ncols == 1 ) // column array
03119       {
03120         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03121         {
03122           m_Matrix.data[0][index] = value;
03123         }
03124         else
03125         {
03126           m_Matrix.cplx[0][index].re = value;
03127           m_Matrix.cplx[0][index].im = 0.0;
03128         }
03129       }
03130       else if( m_Matrix.nrows == 1 ) // row array
03131       {
03132         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03133         {
03134           m_Matrix.data[index][0] = value;
03135         }
03136         else
03137         {
03138           m_Matrix.cplx[index][0].re = value;
03139           m_Matrix.cplx[index][0].im = 0.0;
03140         }
03141       }
03142       else
03143       {
03144         // access the matrix as a singular column array
03145         unsigned col = index / m_Matrix.nrows;
03146         unsigned row = index - col*m_Matrix.nrows;
03147 
03148         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03149         {
03150           m_Matrix.data[col][row] = value;
03151         }
03152         else
03153         {
03154           m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].re = value;
03155           m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].im = 0.0;
03156         }
03157       }
03158     }
03159     return *this;
03160   }
03161 
03162   Matrix::RealOnlyAccess& Matrix::RealOnlyAccess::operator=(RealOnlyAccess& rhs)
03163   {
03164     // Matrix A(1); Matrix B(1);
03165     // A[0] = B[0];
03166 
03167     // Get the value of the rhs.
03168     double val = (const double)rhs;
03169 
03170     // Use the operator= double overload.
03171     *this = val;
03172     return *this;
03173   }
03174 
03175   Matrix::RealOnlyAccess& Matrix::RealOnlyAccess::operator=(Matrix::Element& rhs)
03176   {
03177     // Matrix A(1); Matrix B(1);
03178     // A[0] = B(0);
03179     *this = rhs.real();
03180     return *this;
03181   }

03184   Matrix::RealOnlyAccess::operator const double()
03185   {
03186     // This is indexing the matrix as a vector.
03187     const unsigned index = m_row;
03188     if( IndexCheck(index) )
03189     {
03190       if( m_Matrix.ncols == 1 ) // column array
03191       {
03192         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03193         {
03194           return m_Matrix.data[0][index];
03195         }
03196         else
03197         {
03198           return m_Matrix.cplx[0][index].re;
03199         }
03200       }
03201       else if( m_Matrix.nrows == 1 ) // row array
03202       {
03203         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03204         {
03205           return m_Matrix.data[index][0];
03206         }
03207         else
03208         {
03209           return m_Matrix.cplx[index][0].re;
03210         }
03211       }
03212       else
03213       {
03214         // access the matrix as a singular column array
03215         unsigned col = index / m_Matrix.nrows;
03216         unsigned row = index - col*m_Matrix.nrows;
03217 
03218         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03219         {
03220           return m_Matrix.data[col][row];
03221         }
03222         else
03223         {
03224           return m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].re;
03225         }
03226       }
03227     }
03228     return 0.0; // Should not be reached!
03229   }

03231   bool Matrix::RealOnlyAccess::operator+= (const double scalar)

03247           return true;

03253         {

03260           return true;

03266         unsigned col = index / m_Matrix.nrows;
03267         unsigned row = index - col*m_Matrix.nrows;
03268 
03269         if( m_Matrix.isReal )

03277           return true;

03390   bool Matrix::RealOnlyAccess::operator/= (double scalar)
03391   {
03392     if( scalar == 0.0 )
03393     {
03394       StaticMatrixError( "Divide by zero not allowed (real vector element division). Matrix X(10); X[0]/0.0!" );
03395       return false; // should not reach this code.
03396     }
03397       
03398     // This is indexing the matrix as a vector.
03399     const unsigned index = m_row;
03400     if( IndexCheck(index) )
03401     {
03402       if( m_Matrix.ncols == 1 ) // column array
03403       {
03404         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03405         {
03406           m_Matrix.data[0][index] /= scalar;
03407           return true;
03408         }
03409         else
03410         {
03411           m_Matrix.cplx[0][index].re /= scalar;
03412           return true;
03413         }
03414       }
03415       else if( m_Matrix.nrows == 1 ) // row array
03416       {
03417         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03418         {
03419           m_Matrix.data[index][0] /= scalar;
03420           return true;
03421         }
03422         else
03423         {
03424           m_Matrix.cplx[index][0].re /= scalar;
03425           return true;
03426         }
03427       }
03428       else
03429       {
03430         // access the matrix as a singular column array
03431         unsigned col = index / m_Matrix.nrows;
03432         unsigned row = index - col*m_Matrix.nrows;
03433 
03434         if( m_Matrix.isReal )
03435         {
03436           m_Matrix.data[col][row] /= scalar;
03437           return true;
03438         }
03439         else
03440         {
03441           m_Matrix.cplx[col][row].re /= scalar;
03442           return true;
03443         }
03444       }
03445     }
03446     return false; // Should not be reached!
03447   }
